subject: Travel
title: The Reunification Express of Vietnam
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Reunification Express of Vietnam.

hook.text: Vietnam's Reunification Express runs 1,072 miles from Hanoi to Ho Chi Minh City in 33 hours.

buildup.text: Originally built by the French, the railway was bombed and destroyed repeatedly during the Vietnam War.

discovery.text: After reunification in 1976, Vietnam rebuilt the line as a symbol of national unity.

twist.text: The train still averages only 33 mph. It uses the same narrow-gauge tracks the French laid in 1936.

climax.text: Tourists love it for the scenery â€” coastal cliffs, rice paddies, and mountain passes fill the windows.

punchline.text: A slow train through Vietnam moves faster than history.

quiz.question: Why is the Vietnamese railway called the Reunification Express?
options: It was the first train in Asia
It was rebuilt after the war as a symbol of unity
It runs between two reunited stations
